djangotailoring.accounts.accesscodes¶

Access Codes are often structured in such a way that they are easily generated, and validated. The base class Code contains most of the functionality.

Also part of the standard set of Code generators is the pair of Basic code classes. A Basic code consists of two letters followed by four digits. Regular versions of the Basic codes have their letters drawn from A-T, while the test versions have their letters drawn from the range W-Z. This way, codes can be distinguished at a glance.

Classes¶

class djangotailoring.accounts.accesscodes.Code(accesscode)¶
Parameters:accesscode (a string) – an access code

Represents a single access code object. Can be queried for validity and existence in the authentication system. Class methods exist for new code generation. Codes that are generated are random strings of 15 letters and numbers.

is_valid(self)¶
Return type:a boolean

Identifies whether the current Code is valid per the rules defined by the class.

get_user(self)¶
Return type:a django.contrib.auth User
Returns:User model associated with this code. If no such user exists, raises User.DoesNotExist.
create_user(self)¶
Return type:a django.contrib.auth User
Returns:a new User for this new access code, set without a password or last_login time. None if the code already exists.
get_or_create_user(self)¶
Return type:a tuple of (django.contrib.auth User, boolean)
Returns:a User for this code, along with a boolean indicating whether the user was created or not.
classmethod generate_new_code(cls)¶
Return type:an instance of cls

Subclasses should implement this class method to customize how access codes strings are built. This method should not attempt to check whether a code it generated was already used.

classmethod code_generator(cls)¶

An iterator that will contiunously yield new codes per generate_new_code()

classmethod codes_in_database(cls, codes)¶
Parameters:codes (a collection of strings) – a set of access codes
Return type:a list of strings
Returns:all access codes in codes that are currently in use in the Users table.
classmethod new_code(cls)¶
Return type:an instance of cls
Returns:an instance that does not have an associated User in the database.
classmethod new_codes(cls, size)¶
Parameters:size (a positive integer) – the number of codes you wish to generate.
Return type:an iterable of cls instances
Returns:a collection of instances of size size. Instances returned are guaranteed not to have Users in the database at the time of generation.

Basic Codes¶

class djangotailoring.accounts.accesscodes.BasicAccessCode¶

A code class that generates codes in the format “LLDDDD”, where L is an uppercase ASCII letter from the set containing A-T, and D is a base-10 digit.

class djangotailoring.accounts.accesscodes.BasicTestCode¶

A BasicAccessCode whose letters will only be in the set of letters containing W-Z rather than A-T. This distinguishes them from regular BasicAccesCodes easily.
